data.text: But now the youngest have laughed me to scorn,
Yea, why had I the strength of their hands?
One is childless in want and famine,
Who compass the salt places on the sounding shore,
Thieves have risen up against me,
Whose houses were the caves of the rocks,
They will cry out among the rustling bushes.
They are sons of fools and vile men,
But now I am their music,
And they stood aloof and abhorred me,
For he has opened his quiver and afflicted me:
They have risen up against me on the right hand of their offspring;
My paths are ruined;
And he has pleaded against me as he will:
My pains return upon me;
Even now my life shall be poured forth upon me;
And by night my bones are confounded;
With great force my disease has taken hold of my garment:
And thou hast counted me as clay;
And I have cried to thee, but thou hearest me not:
They attacked me also without mercy:
And thou hast put me to grief,
For I know that death will destroy me:
Oh then that I might lay hands upon myself,
Yet I wept over every helpless man;
But I, when I waited for good things,
My belly boiled, and would not cease:
I went mourning without restraint:
I am become a brother of monsters,
And my skin has been greatly blackened,
My harp also has been turned into mourning,
